s.text: The states face quite a challenge in finding employment for all these people.
But poor people are usually not in a position to demand stock options.
But poor people are usually not in a position to demand stock options.
Now that Washington has stopped guaranteeing welfare benefits, a compassionate government surely owes its poorest citizens no less than this.
People are unlikely to invest in the feeding and care of others if they are not in a position to reap the benefits.
It supplies less money, not more, to the states, frees them to cut off benefits, and largely leaves the details to them to figure out.
People are unlikely to invest in the feeding and care of others if they are not in a position to reap the benefits.
